narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: This is perhaps the most important course I took at Yale. It was very hard at first but as I look back I am amazed by how much we have learned. Moreover, I am amazed by how much I am able to do. Burak was always available and helpful. He even is nice enough to help guide me as I apply what I'm learning in this class to what I'm using in my other coursework and research. It makes me sad that he is leaving because NO ONE ELSE AT YALE teaches dynamic systems. This is not OK given that most of the MESC are researching dynamic systems interactions. I think this course should be mandatory for all MESCs. It should be noted that I have never written a response like this. This class, teacher and topic where amazing and essential to my education here. I am frustrated, like many of my other classmates, that we cannot pursue this form of analysis beyond an introductory level.PLEASE BRING BACK BURAK AND PLEASE CREATE MORE SYSTEM DYNAMICS CLASSES FOR US.
I understand that the theoretical material is very dense and I guess difficult to explain in a dynamic way. However, theoretical classes were sometimes tough to follow through.
This was an excellent course and I hope to be able to continue using systems modeling in some fashion during teh rest of my time at FES.

There was clearly a lot of effort put into this class by Prof. Burak, he was also really accessible. But this class was an experiment, and due to the inexperience we were overworked with assignments of little value. Compared to the other classes this is the class I put most time to and from which I gained an average learning. The vensim trial version program was painful. Not sure if the professional program is more reliable but if so, I would highly recommend buying that version and providing a better tool to FES students. The TA was not helpful at all.The project was useful in applying the tools learned into something that was more relevant to my interests. Systems dynamics can in fact be a good framework and provide great tools for environmental managers. And I am sure that with time and some more experience Prof. Burak will do a great job teaching it.
Intense but the only way to learn modeling.

This was a good, hard class that took a lot of effort and time but i learned a lot. It was well taught and organized--sometimes a bit dry (especially the more theoretical lectures) but overall very interesting. He's a really nice guy also and very helpful individually.

Lab work- often very time consuming (re-creating complex models) and sometimes did not contribute much to learningTA for the course- lectures given by the TA were not very useful; could have read the same information from the book; TA was not very helpful during lab sessions and not very responsive to email questions
Learning about the different components of model building and the general systems dynamics approach to problem solving.
The course material
The labs helped understand the theoretical material very well.
Close interaction with Burak, the instructor, and a relatively new way to think about problems.
Learning a tool I can use throughout my studies from here on out.
The amount that it impacted my thinking about my other projects. I think the benefits of this methodology will be of great use far beyond my abilities to use the Vensim software.
The subject matter is incredibly important and fills an important gap at FES. The textbook also provided a good foundation for the course.
Getting a hands-on understanding of systems dynamics modeling and covering a broad range of issues.
hands on classes rock! The Andrew Ford book used was perfect and very helpful.

Dr. Guneralp knows his stuff really well and held the class to a higher standard than most classes here--he expected us to learn some complex concepts and people rose to the challenge. The most challenging class I've taken here but lots of payoff if you are interested in the topic.
the final project; I felt that this contributed the most to my learning and internalizing of the course material

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: we need more of these courses!!!
The laboratory and homework assignments. Also, and I know this is not possible, but the modeling software could also use quite a bit of work.

The expectations for the labs and homework were very poorly explained. I felt like before I did the homework I had very little idea of what was being looked for. I felt like the grading for homeworks and the labs were a black box, homework in .... grades out.

A gradient of assignments running from basic to advanced. We had about six straightforward assignments, then jumped into the deep end. The challenge was too much and I understood little about the details by the end of the class. (Conceptually, it was still fine.)
Too many lab/homework assignments.
The number of assignments, particularly reading responses was a little heavy and did not necessarily add much to my learning. But, otherwise, no complaints.

Some of the concepts were not explained with the greatest clarity, and sometimes (especially when they were not covered in labs) I had trouble seeing how they might be applied.I also think this course might benefit from a final exam, instead of a final project, which might help draw all the concepts from the different parts of the class together.
I would include more model building from scratch -- the labs all involved models that were already built for us. The only time we built a model from scratch was for the term project.
The lectures were a bit slow and sometimes hard to follow.

It was a lot of work, especially at the beginning--labs and homework every week, plus quizzes, and a major final project and paper. Maybe a bit too much busy work at the beginning. Working in groups for the labs would have been helpful I think--sometimes you really needed to talk it out with someone else, and it probably would have gone faster. Some of the theoretical stuff lost us at the end.
more useful lab assignments; fewer homework assignments that are designed to summarize readings; fewer homework assigments in general- the lab and homework assignments overlapped a great deal

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Burak was so helpful and always available to help. This is not an easy course and our project was very complex. He was amazing. It was hard,especially at first, but we had to do all that modeling homework to be able to produce our final projectsI think I spoke to the TA once. She wasn't helpful (but perhaps that wasn't her fault)

The TA was woefully unprepared for her role in this class, completely lacking advanced knowledge of the modeling software used for the laboratory assignments. In addition, what information she did have she was wholly unable to communicate in a meaningful way to the students. Her comments were often not only unclear but actually misleading. Her selection as TA for this course (or for that matter, any other which requires proficiency in the English language) was a highly suspect decision.
Burak was great and very helpful!
The instructor was very helpful and very responsive all the time
I did not take great advantage of Burak's availability, but he was extremely accommodating.
Instructor was very available and helpful, TA less so.
Burak was very responsive and available for help. Plus he was helpful.
not very helpful the few times I did ask for help on a lab.

Prof. Guneralp was really helpful and very responsive to student questions. He gave a lot of time to student projects at the end of the semester and was critical to making the class the success that it was.
I had to contact both for help and they were very responsive and helpful.
The professor was very helpful and open to meeting with students and helpful via email.

Prof Guneralp was very responsive and offered constructive criticism; he seems to care deeply about the subject matter and the integrity of the work as well as the learning of the students in the course.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: Despite its shortcomings, the course introduces a set of intellectual tools and a framework for approaching complex problems which is essential.
An interest in conputer science and computer work and mathematics.
I intend to pursue similar methods to those taught in this class as I design my master's project.

I feel very lucky that I was able to take this course during my first semester at FES. I hope that it will be taught in the future and that I might be able to work with faculty that are familiar with systems modeling and who will be responsive to this type of interdisciplinay critical thinking.
It didn't really, but I am interested in climate change and building models is obviously used in that field.
It was more of a theoretical interest that didn't directly fit into my studies but seemed interesting--it was actually less connected to the modeling I was hoping to study than I thought though. 0
I took this course to fulfill bin 7 for the MEM degree, but I found that I learned a great deal more than I expected and I hope to incorporate systems dynamic modeling into my future work.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Personal interest in systems dynamics.
Bin requirement
It sounded interesting at the beginning of the semester, and it came recommended by Karen Seto.
To get a sampling of the environmental problems out there that might use systems modeling to help understand or solve the problem.
I hoped that it would be a benefit later when working on an independent project.
I wanted to understand how models are built and what they are used for.

Because I have seen modeling studies cited in many papers and used for many policy instruments but didn't actually understand what that meant. I wanted an in-depth tutorial on the potential of modeling for environmental problems.
I was working on some types of modeling and thought this would help, though it turned out to be very specific to systems dynamic modeling only, without too much reference to any other approaches.
See Q15.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: The reasons cited above.
Yes
I didint know what to expect when i took it and I really enjoyed it.
Yes.
Yes.
Mostly.
Yes.The class far surpassed my expectations.
Yes. I wish I could say I understood more about policy making.
Yes
Mostly--I learned a lot and got very familiar with the topic, though I was hoping to focus on some other types of modeling as well which we did not cover. But it was a good class.
Yes, the course exceeded my expectations; I learned more than I expected, including complex topics in systems dynamic modeling as well as how this technique is used across disciplines.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: I got more out of it than I expected (and I expected a lot).
Yes and No. I am confident in my capacity for systems thinking however my facility with the modeling software is not where I would have hoped it would be.
Yes
Yes.
Yes.
Mostly.

No. Not at all. My expectations were rather uninformed and limited. i think I learned far broader and far reaching skills than I expected from what appeared to be a software oriented class. thank you Burak.
mostly
Yes
Mostly though it's pretty specific to systems dynamic modeling.
See Q17

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Advantages: division of labor.
It helped me a lot

Only one person at a time can work on systems models efficiently, unless the models can be broken up somehow. Instead of working together, my group divided tasks and only learned about our particular task.
The usual difficulties and benefits of group work. Pick a partner that has comparable skill in modeling, otherwise the workload becomes skewed.

Group work was fantastic. i am thankful that the professor was open to our applying the skills learned i nthe class to research my partner and I were pursuing for anotehr cours.e It was a great addition to our learning and really helped me see the applied value of this method of systems inquiry.
I learned a lot from my group -- they gave me ideas i hadn't thought of. The disadvantage was that coordinating and finding time to meet slowed the progress and development of the model.
It was great to team up with other classmates, clearly some do more work than others... but in general it was good to learn from each other and have some fun while working.

Advantages: Modeling can't be done in just one session and there are so many complexities its great to have another mind to talk things through and bounce things off eachother. Plus modeling is a lot of work and by yourself it would be very difficult to get results in a short time frame.Disadvantages: being Yale students we are all really busy and finding time to meet in person was difficult.

Very helpful to work in groups for the final project--it was a lot of work and it was great to have someone else with different expertise to bounce things off of and add to the project. Would have been great to have more group work for labs and homework!

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Prepare for some serious frustration...and long hours of struggling of fussy software.
You should take it!
For a final project, design your own model. Don't build on to another. The experience is more valuable and interesting.
Take it if you're interested in what modeling has to offer. Be wary if you have previous modeling experience.
take the class. think broadly and apply your group project to something you are genuinely interested. these are tedious models if you don't really care about the subject matter.
Take this class! It gives widely-applicable and very important skills for environmental professionals.
do the readings.
Allocate enough time each week for readings and labwork. Pick a group project that is exciting and doable by finals week. Don't procrastinate in this course or you won't get enough out of it!

Get ready for a time commitment with the labs and homework--don't get behind either. But you will learn a lot if you put the time in. The book was really helpful but some of the articles and other readings were pretty long and less interesting.

Definitely think seriously about taking the course if offered again; even though it may not seem useufl, systems modeling can actually be applied to many other areas of environmental science and the perspective it gives you can be invaluable.
